[2] Laboratory animal models have confirmed the respiratory toxicity of diacetyl and its substitute, 2,3-pentanedione. [3] A decade of investigation led to the formal proposal in 2011 of recommended exposure limits for diacetyl and 2,3-pentanedione in the USA.
